children.value: Welcome ðŸ‘‹ to the official docs for Hummingbot, the open-source software client that helps you build and run high-frequency trading bots on any crypto exchange.

<Callout
  type="warning"
  body="Hummingbot is experimental, open-source software that is still in beta, and you use it at your own risk. Please review the [Apache 2.0 license]."

The Hummingbot ecosystem is a globally distributed community of algorithmic traders
and developers who utilize and contribute to the open-source Hummingbot codebase.
Hummingbot is an open-source trading engine that helps you run automated, algorithmic trading strategies (
) that can run on centralized and decentralized exchanges. Hummingbot utilizes a modular architecture that enables exchange connectors and trading strategies to be written independently.
: Quickstart guides, FAQs, video tutorials, and case studies on Hummingbot and Hummingbot Miner
: Learn about Hummingbot and market-making as an algo trading strategy
This documentation site is organized into the following sections:
: Learn how to install Hummingbot in various environments
: Learn how to use Hummingbot commands and other useful configuration
: Learn about the various supported connectors info and configuration
: Learn how to use the various supported strategies and their parameters
Hummingbot is a general source framework for crypto algorithmic trading. We welcome developers to fork the codebase for their own purposes and contribute to the community.
: Learn how to build Hummingbot connectors
: Learn how to build Hummingbot strategies
: Learn how to use and customize existing Hummingbot scripts
: General information about Hummingbot, translated into Mandarin Chinese
